item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It takes a great deal of bravery to stand up to our enemies, but just as much to stand up to our friends." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "To the well-organized mind, death is but the next great adventure." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "I solemnly swear that I am up to no good." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Of course it is happening inside your head, Harry, but why on earth should that mean that it is not real?" -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Do not pity the dead, Harry. Pity the living, and, above all those who live without love." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Numbing the pain for a while will make it worse when you finally feel it." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "He can run faster than Severus Snape confronted with shampoo." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Let us step into the night and pursue that flighty temptress, adventure." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "I DON'T CARE!" Harry yelled at them, snatching up a lunascope and throwing it into the fireplace. "I'VE HAD ENOUGH, I'VE SEEN ENOUGH, I WANT OUT, I WANT IT TO END, I DON'T CARE ANYMORE!" "You do care," said Dumbledore. He had not flinched or made a single move to stop Harry demolishing his office. His expression was calm, almost detached. "You care so much you feel as though you will bleed to death with the pain of it." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is my belief... that the truth is generally preferable to lies." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Dumbledore says people find it far easier to forgive others for being wrong than being right." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Youth can not know how age thinks and feels. But old men are guilty if they forget what it was to be young." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is a curious thing, Harry, but perhaps those who are best suited to power are those who have never sought it. Those who, like you, have leadership thrust upon them, and take up the mantle because they must, and find to their own surprise that they wear it well." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "You should write a book," Ron told Hermione as he cut up his potatoes, "translating mad things girls do so boys can understand them." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Every second he breathed, the smell of the grass, the cool air on his face, was so precious: To think that people had years and years, time to waste, so much time it dragged, and he was clinging to each second." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "The mind is not a book, to be opened at will and examined at leisure. Thoughts are not etched on the inside of skulls, to be perused by an invader. The mind is a complex and many-layered thing." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Differences of habit and language are nothing at all if our aims are identical and our hearts are open." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "He must have known I'd want to leave you." "No, he must have known you would always want to come back." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "You think the dead we loved truly ever leave us? You think that we don't recall them more clearly in times of great trouble?" -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "According to Madam Pomfrey, thoughts could leave deeper scars than almost anything else." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "When you have seen as much of life as I have, you will not underestimate the power of obsessive love." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Caro add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "What would come, would come...and you would have to meet it, when it did." -- J.K. Rowling
